required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Evaluation of Ankle Joint Braces Efficiency
clinical_study.official_title: The Evaluation of Ankle Joint Braces Efficiency
clinical_study.source: Józef Piłsudski University of Physical Education

brief_summary.textblock: The project concerns the evaluation of commercially available ankle joint braces effectiveness used as orthopedic supply after ankle joint ligaments tear injury. Authors hypothesize that the restriction of range of motion may be not sufficient in the early healing process.

primary_outcome.description: Ankle angles, Hindfoot Tibia angles and Forefoot Hindfoot angles caculated by Oxford Foot Model, colected with the use of Vicon Motion Capture system

arm_group.description: Gait measured by Vicon Nexus System

arm_group.arm_group_label: young adults with chronic ankle joint instability
arm_group.description: Gait measured by Vicon Nexus System

intervention.description: The influence of ankle joint brace 1 on gait biomechanics
intervention.arm_group_label: young adults with chronic ankle joint instability

intervention.description: The influence of ankle joint brace 2 on gait biomechanics
intervention.arm_group_label: young adults with chronic ankle joint instability

intervention.description: The influence of ankle joint brace 3 on gait biomechanics
intervention.arm_group_label: young adults with chronic ankle joint instability

intervention.description: The influence of ankle joint brace 4 on gait biomechanics
intervention.arm_group_label: young adults with chronic ankle joint instability

intervention.description: The influence of ankle joint brace 5 on gait biomechanics
intervention.arm_group_label: young adults with chronic ankle joint instability

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 18-35
- female or male
- good health condition
- chronic ankle joint instability (for chronic ankle instability group)
Exclusion Criteria:
- lower limb injuries (last 6 months)
- extreme sports athletes
- no chronic ankle joint instability (for chronic ankle instability group)

facility.name: Józef Piłsudski University of Physical Education in Warsaw

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Józef Piłsudski University of Physical Education
